summary: A letter dated December 1, 2020, addressed to Judge Alison J. Nathan from a friend of Ghislaine Maxwell, defending Maxwell's character. The writer describes Maxwell's kindness in providing free housing and asserts her innocence regarding the charges against her.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The letter is addressed to her as the presiding judge in Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the letter; the writer defends her character, describes her providing free housing, and asserts her innocence of the charges.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judge over Maxwell's criminal case, to whom this character reference letter is addressed.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A friend of Ghislaine Maxwell wrote a character reference letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan on December 1, 2020.
The writer states Maxwell provided them free housing for over 25 years out of kindness, with no expectation of return.
The writer asserts Maxwell is innocent of the charges against her and deserves due process and humane treatment.
The letter is intended to influence the court's perception of Maxwell's moral character prior to her trial.
